business.headline: Rupee falls to alll-time low against dollar amid oil price surgeThe rupee weakened to 83.99 per dollar, slightly surpassing its previous all-time low of 83.9850 recorded on September 12, and down from the 83.9675 level seen in the prior trading session.

Murthy lauded Ratan Tata as a 'compassionate human being who transcended financial status and official power.'

Star Health confirms data breach, clears CISO of wrongdoing amid claimsStar Health Insurance released a statement acknowledging the cyberattack. The company confirmed that it was a victim of a targeted malicious cyberattack, which led to unauthorised access to certain data.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Akhilesh Yadav vs BJP over barricade at Lucknow's JP Narayan CentreThe BJP hit out at Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav's claim that tin sheets were installed in front of the JP Narayan Centre's main gate to prevent his entry to mark the birth anniversary of the socialist leader, calling it "childish".

Solutions to problems can't come from battlefield: PM at East Asia summitAddressing the East Asia Summit in Laos, PM Modi emphasised the importance of India's engagement with ASEAN countries and the need for global cooperation in the face of rising conflicts and tensions.

Goddess Kali's crown, gifted by PM, stolen from Bangladesh temple, India reactsThe silver, gold-plated crown was gifted to the goddess Kali at the Jeshoreshwari Temple in Satkhira by Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi in 2021 during his visit.

Bengaluru man threatens woman with acid attack for her choice of clothes, firedA man in Bengaluru was fired from his job after he threatened to throw acid at a woman when he objected to her choice of clothes in a social media post.
Aurora lights up Leh skies as geomagnetic storm hits EarthSkies in Leh, Ladakh were lit up by a rare aurora borealis due to a strong geomagnetic storm that reached Earth on Thursday.

KTR's shoutout to Omar Abdullah on J&K comeback, he respondsPolitical leaders from across party lines congratulated National Conference leader Omar Abdullah after his party won a majority in the Jammu and Kashmir Assembly elections.

Saurabh Chandrakar, mastermind of Mahadev app betting scam, arrested in DubaiThe Mahadev app allegedly operated through a network of panel operators across India, facilitating money laundering from illegal betting activities. Chandrakar is also suspected of having links to the D Company.

Delivery man killed after Audi rams his bike in Pune, driver detainedThe accident occurred in Pune when the Audi first hit three people riding an Activa, causing them to fall and sustain minor injuries. Shortly after, the luxury car rammed a biker, a Swiggy delivery agent, who later succumbed to his injuries.

India's food plate is greenest in the world, says international study The report underscores that if more countries were to adopt India's dietary habits, it would lead to a notable reduction in environmental damage and help mitigate the impacts of climate change by the year 2050.

Ryan Salame, crypto fraud convict, announces 'new position' on LinkedInRyan Salame, a convict in the FTX cryptocurrency fraud case, updated his LinkedIn profile to announce his "new position" as an inmate at the Federal Correctional Institution.

Tesla Cybercab robotaxi revealed, to cost below $30,000Tesla revealed its fully autonomous driverless robotaxi, the Cybercab, on Friday.  Priced below $30,000, the Cybercab does not have a traditional charging port and will rely on wireless charging.

Actor Shruti Haasan slams IndiGo over 4-hour delay in Mumbai, airline respondsActor Shruti Haasan recently called out IndiGo after her flight from Mumbai was delayed for four hours 'without Information'. Soon after the actor's post on X, the airline apologised for the inconvenience.

Thank you Rafael Nadal for teaching the world why it's important to not give upRafael Nadal's tennis career was defined by his warrior spirit, fighting every point as if it were life or death. His dominance on clay courts, particularly at Roland Garros with 14 French Open titles, was unmatched. Nadal's legacy will be remembered not just for his titles, but for his perseverance, humility, and the heart he poured into every match.

When PM brought Nano plant to Gujarat after 1 word SMS to Ratan Tata in 2008Then Gujarat Chief Minister Narendra Modi had sent a one word SMS to the then Tata Group Chairman Ratan Tata after the Nano project was withdrawn from West Bengal in 2008.

Kisme? Virat Kohli's hilarious reaction to fan's Border Gavaskar Trophy requestVirat Kohli had a hilarious reaction when a fan asked him to set the Border Gavaskar Trophy stage on fire in Australia. Kohli will be a key player for India during the series down under, which will begin in November.

Emmanuel Macron remembers Ratan Tata: France lost a dear friend from IndiaFrench President Emmanuel Macron praised Ratan Tata's contributions to innovation and manufacturing, as well as his role in strengthening India-France ties, along with his lasting legacy of philanthropy and humility.

Samajwadi Party worker chains himself in protest as JP Narayan Centre barricadedA Samajwadi Party worker chained himself in protest outside the residence of party chief Akhilesh Yadav. Police sealed and barricaded JP Narayan Centre in Lucknow.

Iran warns Gulf nations against helping Israel, says 'will respond accordingly'The Gulf Arab nations have urged the US to prevent Israel from targeting Iran's oil facilities, fearing that Tehran may retaliate by striking their own oil infrastructure in the region.

Can a pretty office desk help you work better?Millennials and Gen Zers are sprucing up their work desks with all things beautiful, even if it comes with spending significant money. And it turns out, the move is not solely driven by the motive of acing the social media game.

sports.headline: He lacks common sense outside of cricket: Root's hilarious praise for BrookSenior England batter Joe Root heaped praise on Harry Brook for his sensational triple-century in Multan Test. Lakshya Sen knocked out in Round of 16, George loses to ChristieStar Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen was knocked out of the Arctic Open badminton tournament after a hard-fought match against Chou Tien Chen of Chinese Taipei in the pre-quarterfinals on Thursday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
